ygData.subject: Re: Embedded Heritrix 1.4.0 works under JDK 1.5 but not under 1.4.2
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I actually use only the heritrix-1.4.0.jar in our system without the the jmxri*.jar and the jmxtools*.jars from your distribution. As I have pointed out,
ygData.rawEmail:
Return-Path: <holger@...>
X-Sender: holger@...
X-Apparently-To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com

Received: from [66.218.66.70] by mailer1.bulk.scd.yahoo.com with NNFMP; 05 Jul 2005 10:00:00 -0000
Date: Tue, 05 Jul 2005 09:59:58 -0000
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Message-ID: <dadlmu+5cdr@...>
In-Reply-To: <42C598B5.2070909@...>

From: "Holger Stenzhorn" <holger@...>
Subject: Re: Embedded Heritrix 1.4.0 works under JDK 1.5 but not under 1.4.2
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=81478527; y=SZusP0f_-W4ma6BmP3AB20uIf7ywAPW0td2Ubf9CcQhyVtQtYKAVEfoZ
X-Yahoo-Profile: holgerstenzhorn

Hi,

I actually use only the heritrix-1.4.0.jar in our system without the
the jmxri*.jar and the jmxtools*.jars from your distribution.

As I have pointed out, the error happens in JBoss 3.2.6/7 but not in
4.0.1. So probably their JMX-implementation is kinda buggy, I guess...

I have a home-grown system UI so I don't use the actual Heritrix-UI.

The idea to provide Heritrix as a EAR is very good and would suit our
needs quite well.

Bye,
Holger

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
> Holger Stenzhorn wrote:
> 
> > Hi,
> >
> > I used Maven 1.0.2 and JDK 1.4.2 to do the rebuild of Heritrix
> > yesterday so it was definitely a JDK 1.4 compatible build.
> >
> > But since the error persisted I had to dig deeper and took a look at
> > the JARs in the runtime classpath: I am running Heritrix in a webapp
> > inside JBoss 3.2.6 and so it inherits its JARs. By trial and error I
> > have found that jboss-jmx.jar causes the problem. After removing this
> > JAR Heritrix works fine. Further testing revealed that this problem
> > still exists in 3.2.7 but is gone in 4.0.1 (at least I tested on those
> > two). ...why that error happens, I don't know since I have not looked
> > at the source of that JAR.
> 
> Probably because we include the JMX reference implementation in
Heritrix 
> and its clashing with the jboss JMX implementation.  What happens if
you 
> leave in place the jboss-jmx jar and instead remove from under Heritrix 
> jmxri*.jar and the jmxtools*.jars?
> 
> Does your bundling reveal the Heritrix UI or is it your apps UI that 
> shows -- with your UI revealing the current state of the underlying
crawl?
> 
> On and off I've been experimenting trying to bundle Heritrix as an EAR 
> (I'm having a classpath ordering issue where commons-httpclient can't 
> find the overlays that are in the heritrix jar. Anyone have any 
> suggestions?).  The intent would be to have it so you could just drop 
> Heritrix into a J2EE container and have both its UI and JMX interface 
> auto-deploy.  Heritrix would then be available as a 'service'
useable by 
> other container 'services', and in turn, it'd be possible for Heritrix 
> to make use of container services such as clustering, messaging, etc.
> 
> St.Ack
> 
> >
> > Bye,
> > Holger
> >
> > --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "stackarchiveorg" <stack@a...>
> > wrote:
> > > --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Holger Stenzhorn"
<holger@x>
> > > wrote:
> > > > Hi,
> > > >
> > > > I have embedded Heritrix into an information sytsem I wrote
and there
> > > > I call its API directly.
> > > >
> > > > Until recently I have used Heritrix 1.2 under JDK 1.4. Now I have
> > > > updated to Heritrix 1.4 (with JDK 1.4) and get the following error
> > > > message: "name is not a valid java type (or is a reserved word):
> > > > settings-directory"
> > > >
> > > > If I use JDK 1.5 everything works fine - but for a costumer I
need to
> > > > use JDK 1.4.
> > > >
> > > > When I took a look at the MANIFEST in the JAR file of Heritrix
I saw
> > > > that it was compiled with JDK 1.5. So I rebuild Heritrix from the
> > > > sources with JDK 1.4.
> > > >
> > > > But still the above described error happens as before.
> > >
> > > You get this message trying to compile the application that
integrates
> > > Heritrix? Are you setting the javac '-target' to be 1.4? See
here for
> > > discussion of '-target' on javac:
> > > http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/tooldocs/solaris/javac.html
> > > (Search for 'target').  If your build system is ant, see the
> > > discussion under the 'target' task on this page:
> > > http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/tooldocs/solaris/javac.html
(Again
> > > search for target).
> > >
> > > The Heritrix jar itself should need no modification to run in a 1.4
> > > JVM.  That's our own target JVM version.
> > >
> > > Yours,
> > > St.Ack
> >
> >
> >
> >
